channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024090710
item.description:
Report X-2024090710

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE FOUND TORN AND LEAKING PAINT. UPON INSPECTION, ONE FLAMMABLE CAN HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE LID. THE ONLY OTHER CAN WAS A NON-HAZ ITEM WHICH HAD ALSO LEAKED FROM LOOSE LID. APPEARED THERE WERE NO PAINT CLIPS ON THE CANS. PACKAGE HAD NO HAZMAT MARKINGS OR LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMONDS.

item.title: Report E-2024090173
item.description:
Report E-2024090173

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 4, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the printing ink-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately half a gallon of Pliobond Adhesive released from one 5-gallon metal bucket due to other freight puncturing the container during transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal who felt comfortable cleaning the release with the available PPE onsite.

item.title: Report E-2024090120
item.description:
Report E-2024090120

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 was damaged by other freight and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. CE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN2810-impacted loading dock floor. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon overpack and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums that were staged onsite.
